attributes.action: Teresa May dissolve the Scottish Government as it ignores the democratic wishes
attributes.additional_details:
The Scottish government has wasted two days debating about having a second referendum despite the fact that they do not have the powers to decide if we have another referendum.

The time should have been spent carrying out the jobs that the were voted to carry out, and that is managing the country within the limits of their devolved powers and not ignoring the democratic wishes of the Scottish electorate.
attributes.background:
The SNP and the Greens have ignored the democratic wishes of the Scottish people by voting to peruse another referendum. 

Despite during the election campaign the SNP saying a vote for them was not a vote for independence and the Greens mandate not to support independence.
